comments:
NullPointerException get thrown during TPTP analysis on the log file.

TPTP driver : tptp.sdk-TPTP-4.3.0-200609271134.zip
Import attached (IBM_WebSphere_Application_Server_Version_6.0.2.symptom) Symptom Catalog 
Import any access.log

Perform TPTP xpath analysis on 1 event.

Following error get thrown in the .log file.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.hyades.sdb 2 0 2006-09-28 15:29:25.935
!MESSAGE 
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.provisional.fastxpath.FastXPathAPI.loadCompiledExpressions(FastXPathAPI.java:366)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.symptom.analysis.XPathCorrelationEngine.correlate(XPathCorrelationEngine.java:181)
	at com.ibm.etools.ac.act.analysis.ActAnalysis.correlate(ActAnalysis.java:94)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logc.internal.util.AnalysisFacade.analyzeLog(AnalysisFacade.java:122)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.sdb.internal.util.LogAnalyzerDelegator.correlate(LogAnalyzerDelegator.java:82)

:
Praful, can you confirm that the correlation process run thru the catelog with success?
Need this in TPTP 4.3 i next.
This bug has severity set to "major".  Eugene, why did you target this to "future"?  Thanks.

Malcom, The process is finished correctly, even with the error logged in the .log file. Hence it's considered low priority among the 4.3 defects list. I am targeting i3 for now and will revisit just to make sure the error is handled correctly in the code.

The problem of this defect is on line 181 of XPathCorrelationEngine: fastXPathAPI.loadCompiledExpressions(getSerializedByteCodeCacheFile());

The getSerializedByteCodeCacheFile() function is returning NULL.  This is because the serializedByteCodeCachePath variable never seems to be set.  The setSerializedByteCodeCachePath(String newPath) method, which sets this variable, never seems to be invoked.  I can't understand the logic behind this function due to the lack of comments.

Sheldon, can you please review the patch attach? 
The code in XPathCorrelationEngine.initEngine is modified for the serializedByteCodeCachePath creation.
context property STATELOCATION is never set in TPTP log analysis according to the following execution stack in TPTP (line 212)

Thread [Worker-2] (Suspended (breakpoint at line 203 in XPathCorrelationEngine))	
	XPathCorrelationEngine.initEngine(ICorrelationOperationContext) line: 203	
	XPathCorrelationEngine.correlate(List, List, List, ICorrelationOperationContext) line: 160	
	AnalysisFacade.analyzeLog(IBaseAnalysisOperation, List, List, List, ICorrelationOperationContext) line: 122	
	LogAnalyzerDelegator.correlate(List, List, List, ICorrelationOperationContext) line: 82	
	ExtendedAnalyzeAction$1.run(IProgressMonitor) line: 139	
	Worker.run() line: 58
Reviewed the patch and the fix is good.
patch submitted is reviewed with Sheldon and check in to HEAD (4.3i2)
*** Bug 159315 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
